metadata.title: How to Monetize YouTube 2025: Complete Partner Program Guide
metadata.description: Enable YouTube monetization and join Partner Program. Requirements and setup process.

hero.headline: How to Monetize YouTube
hero.subheadline: From zero to Partner Program. Turn views into revenue.

sections.content: YouTube monetization through the Partner Program lets you earn ad revenue, memberships, Super Chats, and more. There are specific thresholds to reach first, then an application process. Here's exactly how to get monetized and maximize your earning potential.

content.title: 1,000 Subscribers
content.description: Minimum subscriber count required for standard track.

content.title: 4,000 Watch Hours
content.description: Public watch time in past 12 months (excluding Shorts).

content.title: OR 10M Shorts Views
content.description: Alternative path: 10M Shorts views in 90 days.

content.title: Limited Features
content.description: Channel memberships, Super Thanks, Super Chat. No ad revenue.

sections.title: Monetization Setup Process
content: Meet subscriber and watch hour thresholds
Enable ads on existing videos once approved

content.title: Ad Revenue
content.description: Pre-roll, mid-roll, display ads. Your main income source.

content.title: Channel Memberships
content.description: Monthly subscription from fans. Recurring revenue.

content.title: Super Chat / Thanks
content.description: Paid highlights in live chat and comments.

content.title: Merch Shelf
content.description: Sell products directly on your channel.

sections.title: Monetization Tips
content: Higher CPM niches: finance, business, tech
Sponsors often pay more than ads

faq.question: How long does review take?
faq.answer: Usually 1-4 weeks after applying. YouTube reviews channel for policy compliance. Larger backlog sometimes causes delays.

faq.question: Why was I rejected?
faq.answer: Common reasons: reused content, spam, misleading metadata, or insufficient original content. Address issues and reapply after 30 days.

faq.question: How much do YouTubers make?
faq.answer: Varies enormously: $1-$25+ per 1000 views depending on niche, audience location, and ad types. Finance/business highest, entertainment lower.
